item.title: 市场等待特朗普就职，美元持稳
item.description: 本周一，美元在两年多高点附近徘徊，因为唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）将重新入主白宫并发表就职演说，这将是投资者希望解读其近期政策的主要焦点。【原文：The dollar was hovering near a more than two-year high at the start of a pivotal week on Monday, as Donald Trump re-enters the White House with an inauguration speech that will be of primary focus for investors hoping to decipher his immediate policies.】

item.title: 特朗普第二任期来临，美元走强，股市攀升
item.description: 周一，美元坚挺，亚洲股市谨慎向好，因为投资者在等待唐纳德-特朗普就任第二任总统后的头几个小时里预期将宣布的一系列政策，并期待日本在本周末加息。【原文：The dollar was firm and Asia's stock markets were cautiously positive on Monday as investors waited for an expected flurry of policy announcements in the first hours of Donald Trump's second presidency and eyed a rate hike in Japan at the end of the week.】

item.title: 俄罗斯制裁引发的供应担忧持续，油价攀升
item.description: 过去两周，华盛顿因乌克兰战争对俄罗斯能源行业实施了两轮制裁，供应担忧持续存在，油价周一有所回升。【原文：Oil prices recovered on Monday as supply concerns persisted after Washington imposed two rounds of sanctions in the past two weeks on Russia's energy sector over the Ukraine war.】

item.title: 中国维持基准贷款利率不变
item.description: 由于人民币走软限制了中国政府的货币宽松政策，中国周一维持基准贷款利率月度定盘价不变。【原文：China left benchmark lending rates unchanged at the monthly fixing on Monday, as a weakening yuan has limited Beijing's monetary easing efforts.】

item.title: 工厂投资强劲，日本 11 月机械订单超出预期
item.description: 日本政府周一公布的数据显示，日本 11 月份核心机械订单环比增长 3.4%，超出分析师预期，这表明在央行本周晚些时候进行利率审查之前，资本支出有所恢复。【原文：Japan's core machinery orders rose 3.4% in November from the previous month to beat analysts' forecast, government data showed on Monday, signalling a recovery in capital expenditure ahead of a central bank interest rate review later this week.】

item.title: 资产管理公司 VanEck 预计，随着特朗普的回归，国防领域将出现增长
item.description: 投资公司和 ETF 发行商 VanEck 表示，在唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫之前，对领先的国防行业交易所交易基金（ETF）的需求一直在增长。【原文：Demand for a leading defence sector exchange-traded fund (ETF) has been growing ahead of the return of Donald Trump to the White House, said investment company and ETF issuer VanEck.】

item.title: 工会表示，好市多团队工人投票批准在全美范围内举行罢工
item.description: 车队工会周日表示，美国零售商好市多批发公司（Costco Wholesale）的会员投票赞成在全国范围内举行罢工，因为他们已进入最后一轮谈判，以便在 1 月 31 日截止日期前达成新合同。【原文：Teamsters said on Sunday its members at U.S. retailer Costco Wholesale voted in favor of a nationwide strike, as they entered a final round of talks to reach a new contract ahead of a Jan. 31 deadline.】

item.title: 美国 TikTok 爱好者如释重负，希望 "魔力 "随着应用程序的恢复而回归
item.description: 虽然对 TikTok 的未来仍有疑问，但一些用户感叹他们对政府的信任将一去不复返。【原文：While questions linger about the future of TikTok, some users lament their trust in the government will never be the same.】

item.title: 澳大利亚明星娱乐公司公布第二季度亏损报告
item.description: 澳大利亚陷入困境的赌场运营商 Star Entertainment 周一公布了第二季度亏损报告，这增加了该公司未来改造和扭亏为盈的不确定性。【原文：Australia's troubled casino operator Star Entertainment reported a second-quarter loss on Monday, adding to the rising uncertainty about its future revamp and earnings turnaround.】

item.title: 早间竞价就职典礼引发的谨慎情绪为风险复苏降温
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: TikTok 表示正在恢复在美国的服务
item.description: TikTok 周日表示，它正在恢复其在美国的服务，并补充说它将与共和党当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）合作制定一个长期解决方案，让这款中国人拥有的流行社交媒体应用继续留在美国。【原文：TikTok said it was in the process of restoring its service in the U.S. on Sunday, adding it will work with Republican President-elect Donald Trump on a long-term solution that keeps the popular Chinese-owned social media app in the United States.】

item.title: 爱德曼全球调查显示，经济不满助长了对敌对行动的支持
item.description: 据传播公司爱德曼（Edelman）在全球范围内进行的一项民意调查显示，60%的人对经济的担忧已经升级为不满，许多人认为有必要采取暴力等敌对行动来实现变革。【原文：Economic fears have escalated into grievances among 60% of people, with many believing hostile actions such as violence can be necessary to bring about change, according to a global poll by communications firm Edelman.】

item.title: 特朗普安全顾问不排除中国继续拥有 TikTok 的可能性
item.description: Mike Waltzs 说，用户数据必须在美国得到保护和存储。【原文：Mike Waltzs said user data would have to be protected and stored in the U.S.】

item.title: TikTok 对美国用户关闭；特朗普发出干预信号
item.description: 即使是暂时的，TikTok 史无前例的关闭也将对中美关系、国内政治、社交媒体市场以及依赖该应用的数百万美国人产生影响。【原文：Even if temporary, the unprecedented shutdown of TikTok will have an impact on U.S.-China relations, domestic politics, the social-media marketplace and millions of Americans who depend on the app.】

item.title: 美国用户的 TikTok 停止工作
item.description: 上周六，TikTok 在美国 "黑屏"，联邦对中国短视频应用的禁令生效之前，TikTok 在美国的访问被切断，而这个平台曾吸引了近一半的美国人，推动了小企业的发展，并塑造了网络文化。【原文：TikTok went dark in the U.S. on Saturday before a federal ban on the Chinese-owned short-video app took effect, cutting off access to the platform that captivated nearly half of all Americans, fueled small businesses and shaped online culture.】

item.title: TikTok 通知用户周日将在美国 "暂时不可用
item.description: TikTok 周六晚些时候告诉美国用户，周日将 "暂时无法使用 "TikTok，因为禁止使用该应用的法律将在美国生效。【原文：TikTok told users in the United States late on Saturday it would be "temporarily unavailable" on Sunday when a law banning the app takes effect in the United States.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，甲骨文准备从格林尼治标准时间 0200 开始关闭 TikTok 服务器
item.description: 据 The Information 报道，TikTok 美国业务的主要云计算提供商甲骨文公司的领导已通知部分员工，准备在美国法律从周日起禁止 TikTok 应用程序之前，最快于美国东部时间周六晚上 9 点（格林尼治标准时间周日 2 点）关闭托管美国 TikTok 数据的服务器。【原文：Leaders at Oracle, the main cloud computing provider for TikTok's U.S. operations, have told some staff to prepare to shut down servers that host U.S. TikTok data as soon as 9 p.m. ET on Saturday (0200 GMT on Sunday) in advance of a U.S. law banning the app from Sunday, The Information reported.】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，Perplexity AI 有意与 TikTok US 合并
item.description: 据CNBC报道，Perplexity AI周六要求TikTok的中国母公司字节跳动允许这家美国搜索引擎初创公司与TikTok U.S.合并，并创建一个由他们和新资本合伙公司（New Capital Partners）组成的新实体。【原文：Perplexity AI asked TikTok's Chinese parent company, ByteDance, on Saturday to allow the U.S. search engine startup to merge with TikTok U.S. and create a new entity combining them and New Capital Partners, CNBC reported.】

item.title: 特朗普 "极有可能 "给予 TikTok 90 天的缓刑期，使其免受潜在禁令的影响
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周六表示，他 "很有可能 "在周一上任后给予 TikTok 90 天的缓刑期，使其免于在美国受到可能的禁令限制。【原文：U.S. President-elect Donald Trump on Saturday said he would "most likely" give TikTok a 90-day reprieve from a potential ban in the United States after he takes office on Monday.】

item.title: 国有 SEPI 提议更换西班牙电信公司首席执行官
item.description: 周六，一位知情人士告诉路透社，国有投资基金 SEPI 已提议撤换自 2016 年以来一直领导西班牙电信公司的首席执行官何塞-玛丽亚-阿尔瓦雷斯-帕莱特（Jose Maria Alvarez-Pallete）。【原文：State-owned investment fund SEPI has proposed to replace Telefonica's Chief Executive Jose Maria Alvarez-Pallete, who has led the company since 2016, a source with knowledge of the matter told Reuters on Saturday.】

item.title: TikTok 面临美国禁令最后期限，用户做好准备应对后果
item.description: 该平台必须在周日之前与其中国母公司字节跳动断绝关系，或关闭其在美国的业务，以消除对国家安全构成威胁的担忧。【原文：The platform has until Sunday to cut ties with its China-based parent, ByteDance, or shut down its U.S. operation to resolve concerns it posed a threat to national security.】

item.title: 电动汽车初创企业 Canoo 申请破产，将停止运营
item.description: Canoo 周五表示，它将申请破产保护，并立即停止运营。【原文：Canoo said on Friday it would file for Chapter 7 bankruptcy and cease operations, effective immediately.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会敲定 530 亿美元雪佛龙-赫斯合并案同意令
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会（FTC）周五表示，已批准一项同意令，以解决雪佛龙公司（Chevron）以 530 亿美元收购赫斯公司（Hess）的反垄断问题。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commision (FTC) said on Friday it had approved a consent order to resolve antitrust issues concerning Chevron's $53 billion takeover of Hess .】

item.title: 美国机构起诉两家汽车制造商，称其存在歧视和骚扰行为
item.description: 美国平等就业机会委员会（Equal Employment Opportunity Commission）周五起诉了两家大型汽车制造商，指控通用汽车公司（General Motors）和美国汽车工人联合会（United Auto Workers）存在年龄歧视，而包括克莱斯勒在内的斯特兰蒂斯公司（Stellantis unit）则对女性员工进行了性骚扰。【原文：The U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission on Friday sued two large automakers, accusing General Motors and the United Auto Workers of age discrimination and the Stellantis unit that includes Chrysler of subjecting female employees to sexual harassment.】

item.title: 美国联合航空公司向特朗普就职典礼基金捐赠 100 万美元
item.description: 美国联合航空公司周五表示，将向当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的就职委员会捐款 100 万美元，并表示首席执行官斯科特-柯比计划在长假周末出席各种活动。【原文：United Airlines said on Friday it is donating $1 million to President-elect Donald Trump's inaugural committee and said CEO Scott Kirby plans to attend various events over the long holiday weekend.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，特朗普团队计划对联邦机构的财富基金进行改革
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五报道，美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的团队希望美国国际开发金融公司（DFC）的功能更像一个主权财富基金，并成为部署经济力量的有效工具。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump's team wants the U.S. International Development Finance Corp (DFC) to function more like a sovereign wealth fund and be an effective tool for deploying economic power, Bloomberg News reported on Friday.】

item.title: OpenAI 敲定 "o3 mini "人工智能推理模型版本，即将推出
item.description: ChatGPT 制造商 OpenAI 首席执行官山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）周五表示，OpenAI 已经完成了新推理人工智能模型 o3 mini 的定稿，并将在几周内推出。【原文：ChatGPT maker OpenAI has finalized a version of its new reasoning AI model o3 mini and would be launching it in a couple of weeks, CEO Sam Altman said on Friday.】

item.title: 备忘录显示，美国银行在 2024 年业绩强劲后向员工奖励股票
item.description: 据路透社周五看到的一份内部备忘录显示，美国银行将自 2017 年以来第八次向其全球大多数员工发放股票，因为这家美国第二大贷款机构在 2024 年表现强劲。【原文：Bank of America is set to award stock to most of its global employees for the eighth time since 2017, following a robust performance by the second-largest U.S. lender in 2024, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters on Friday.】

item.title: 特朗普计划在执政的头几天颁布有利于加密货币的命令
item.description: 据三位知情人士透露，美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普正计划在上任后的头几天，利用其行政权力减轻加密货币公司面临的监管负担，并促进数字资产的采用。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump is planning to use his executive powers to reduce the regulatory burden faced by cryptocurrency companies and promote digital asset adoption in his first few days in office, according to three people briefed on the plan.】

item.title: 星巴克首席执行官表示，裁员是扭亏战略的一部分
item.description: 星巴克首席执行官布莱恩-尼科尔（Brian Niccol）周五表示，作为公司正在进行的扭亏为盈工作的一部分，这家咖啡巨头将裁员以优化其支持团队。【原文：Starbucks CEO Brian Niccol said on Friday the coffee giant will cut jobs to optimize its support teams as part of the company's ongoing turnaround efforts.】
